support_summary: Splicing factor proline- and glutamine-rich (SFPQ) was identified as a common interactor of both wild-type and cytoplasmic (ΔNLS) TDP-43 using a proximity-dependent biotin identification (BioID) method.

functions.cellular_process: TDP-43 binds to the NEAT1 pre-lncRNA and promotes its polyadenylation to produce the short isoform (NEAT1_1), which does not scaffold paraspeckles. SFPQ is a core component of these nuclear bodies.
functions.effect_description: By promoting the short NEAT1_1 isoform, TDP-43 effectively represses the formation of paraspeckles. Loss of nuclear TDP-43 function shifts the balance towards the long, scaffolding NEAT1_2 isoform, leading to hyper-assembly of paraspeckles, which then sequester other RNA-binding proteins, including SFPQ and TDP-43 itself.
biological_consequence: Loss of TDP-43 → Increased NEAT1_2 lncRNA → Hyper-assembly of paraspeckles → Sequestration of SFPQ and other RBPs → Altered nuclear RNA processing and cellular stress
specific_effects: Loss of TDP-43 function is a primary driver of paraspeckle hyper-assembly in ALS.
NEAT1_2 sequesters TDP-43 away from mRNAs in differentiated cells.
Paraspeckle hyper-assembly may be a protective response in cells with compromised miRNA/dsRNA metabolism.

evidence.paper_title: Cross-Regulation between TDP-43 and Paraspeckles Promotes Pluripotency-Differentiation Transition
Protective paraspeckle hyper-assembly downstream of TDP-43 loss of function in amyotrophic lateral sclerosis

mechanism: SFPQ is a multifunctional DNA/RNA-binding protein involved in splicing and transcription. It interacts with TDP-43, suggesting they are part of shared nuclear protein complexes that regulate gene expression. TDP-43 binds to the NEAT1 pre-lncRNA and promotes its polyadenylation to produce the short isoform (NEAT1_1), which does not scaffold paraspeckles. SFPQ is a core component of these nuclear bodies.
effect: The interaction between TDP-43 and SFPQ points to a cooperative role in RNA metabolism. Both proteins are components of paraspeckles and are involved in maintaining neuronal integrity. The loss of this interaction due to TDP-43 mislocalization could disrupt these functions.; By promoting the short NEAT1_1 isoform, TDP-43 effectively represses the formation of paraspeckles. Loss of nuclear TDP-43 function shifts the balance towards the long, scaffolding NEAT1_2 isoform, leading to hyper-assembly of paraspeckles, which then sequester other RNA-binding proteins, including SFPQ and TDP-43 itself.
summary: TDP43 regulates SFPQ to regulate rna processing and paraspeckle assembly, ultimately affecting neuronal health.
